text: it's midnight and the Liberian national
police are out on a joint patrol with UN
peacekeepers for 14 years civil war
ravaged the dark streets of liberia's
capital Monrovia torture and rape or
remand security with scarce in a
post-conflict society it's very
important that law and order comes back
so that there's a sense of security
amongst the civilians and having women
peacekeepers I think fulfills this
objective women make up a significant
percentage of the multinational police
and peacekeeping forces under the
direction of the United Nations that
entered Liberia after the Civil War they
were affected a lot of women and when
women see other women coming in the
forefront to assist them in peace
building this restores a lot of
confidence into them their formidable
presence patrolling the streets with
Kalashnikovs alongside men at clinics
for women and children for teaching in
schools has had a major impact on the
traumatized women of Liberia you know
peacekeeping or security thing with
macho you know cement business but if
you bikies keepers have been the source
of inspiration for us and friendly
speaking in Liberia right now people
take women seriously in fact the
country's President Ellen Johnson
Sirleaf is the first female head of
state in Africa known as The Iron Lady
she believes women have special skills
for securing the peace and nurturing the
development of a post-conflict society
like Liberia my experience has been that
women tend to be more committed work
harder more honest the woman brings to
the task an extra sensitivity I think
the characteristics have come from being
a mother Sirleaf has appointed women to
cabinet positions and has made efforts
to improve the lives of poor and
uneducated women working in the local
markets
these women say they are grateful for
the new opportunities available to them
women are no longer sitting down waiting
for the horse must of gave their food
they bring out new business they got rid
of right now I feel like I'm a woman but
as a country in transition liberia needs
to rebuild its meager police force and
in a place where violence against women
is widespread the Sirleaf administration
wants more women in uniform we just come
from conflict yeah a lot of gender-based
violence and of course when women go to
the police station they would like to
see a sympathetic face that would
respond to their issues or they
understand their needs the police for
instant has been something that we may
never wanted to participate in because
of the belief that they were corrupted
and women they didn't want to be
associated with that but the UN
peacekeepers won't be around forever by
the end of next year the nation's
ill-equipped police force will be
expected to secure the country's
crumbling streets on its own it is a
daunting task for an underpaid force of
mostly men in a few women with a
reputation for corruption to import them
the right values the right professional
ethics the right qualities that would
make them good law and forces it is
really a challenge so in order to mentor
and train the National Police the female
peacekeepers used an approach that is
already familiar to a lot of them
mothering I'm a mom I for kids I'll
never finished in that role but we are
like parents this is our role to help
them to grow up and once they're 18 we
go away un police officers like Estella
bemba from zambia work closely with
local stations and walk them through
various protocols of investigating
crimes see dr. yellow line we do our
monkey an hour here suppose
for the link the coming week as well as
trying to correct each other cause this
before they all think they look for this
week so we just have to sit down and
remind each other all like white women
to enzyme but even with the best of
intentions the challenges for
post-conflict force are heightened at
night
majority of the city does not have
electricity so at night dilapidated
police stations are sometimes live with
one bare lightbulb or not at all further
in this poor country most Liberians the
police included do not have cars phones
or centralized number to call in case of
emergencies the joint checkpoints and
foot patrols are small but inexpensive
attempts to get the police out in the
community and rebuilding a sense of
security we are trying to take the
police tobago to become acquainted to
become familiar with people so that at
least there are being sense days on some
of it tools and don't there's still a
lot to be done in training and mentoring
and getting the librarian National
Police up and running it'll take a long
while before the government is able to
fully financed everything that is needed
for the police force will have to do a
lot of work the next couple of years but
there is a bright spot slowly but surely
Liberian women are appearing in uniform
they say they are inspired by the female
to peacekeepers West woman was not
speaking in public places and now women
are they are working on some of the
ministries they are more Road out if we
